page.title: 04SHOPS
page.content: THERE ARE SEVEN SHOPS IN BOZEAT AND NONE IN EASTON MAUDIT.IN BOZEAT THERE IS THE CO-OP AND ANTIQUE SHOP IN LONDON ROAD. A BIT FURTHER UP LONDON ROAD IS VERA'S. VERA'S SELLS SWEETS,CAKES AND CRISPS. ALONG THE HIGH STREET IS THE NEWSAGENTS. IN CAMDEN SQUARE IS THE POST OFFICE AND SPAR SUPERMARKET.ON THE CORNER OF MILE STREET IS SPARKEY'S,THE ELECTRIC SHOP.AT THE TOP OF MILE STREET IS THE BUTCHERS.OPPOSITE THE CO-OP IS THE ONLY PUBLIC HOUSE IN BOZEAT CALLED "THE RED LION"THIS WAS BOUGHT BY THE MARQUIS OF NORTHAMPTON 1N 1801.HE WOULD KEEP HORSES THERE TO BRING VISITORS FROM THE LONDON COACH TO HIS HOUSE AT CASTLE ASHBY NEAR BY.
